oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Priorities and approach of the Dutch research in organic food and farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blom-Zandstra, Dr.Ir. M.
Wijnands, Ir. F.G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Research methodology and philosophy
Research communication and quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic research in the Netherlands is strongly tuned to the actual demand from the organic sector or enterprises on one hand and future societal development on the other hand. It comprises research activities at different levels varying from strategic (long term) research to production of applied know-ledge. A multidisciplinary approach and participation of different stakeholders in all phases, from devise to result, are important characteristics of the research.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Blom-Zandstra, Dr.Ir. M. and Wijnands, Ir. F.G. (2006) Priorities and approach of the Dutch research in organic food and farming. Poster at: Joint Organic Congress, Odense, Denmark, May 30-31, 2006.
